text: Bruce Baillie (September 24, 1931 - April 10, 2020) was an American avant- garde cinematic artist. He was the founder of Canyon Cinema in San Francisco in 1961. He was born in Aberdeen, South Dakota. His best known movie was Castro Street. Baillie died on April 10, 2020 at his home in Camano Island, Washington at the age of 88.Bruce Baillie, Catalytic Avant-Garde Filmmaker, Dies at 88 ==References== ==Other websites== *Bruce Baillie's Official Website *Bruce Baillie at Canyon Cinema * *Bruce Baillie's official YouTube channel *Five collected films by Bruce Baillie (including Castro Street and All My Life (latter with soundtrack by Ella Fitzgerald) on YouTube) Category:1931 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American movie directors Category:American movie producers Category:American military personnel of the Korean War Category:American artists Category:People from Aberdeen, South Dakota Category:Businesspeople from South Dakota Category:Businesspeople from San Francisco Category:Artists from San Francisco Category:Military people from South Dakota
title: Bruce Baillie
